```{r}
#install.packages("readxl")
library(readxl)

#install.packages("tidyverse")
library(tidyverse)

#install.packages("writexl")
library(writexl)

#install.packages("openxlsx")
library(openxlsx)

# Load the clipr package
library(clipr)
```

```{r}
totalSocial <- read_excel("LT_100.xlsx", sheet = "2023", skip = 65) %>% #selecting most recent set of data
  rename(dclgCode = ...1, onsCode = ...2, localAuthority = `390700.0`, private = `426419.0`, otherPublic = `3451.0`, privateSector = `2969640.0`, total = `3790210.0`) %>% #cleaning headers of sheet
  slice_head(n = 33) %>% #removes rest of data so it only includes London Boroughs
  select(onsCode, "London Boroughs", private) %>%
  arrange(desc(private)) #arrange in descending order 
```
